skill.name: secret-scanner
skill.description: Detect accidentally committed secrets, credentials, and sensitive information in code.
skill.summary: Detect accidentally committed secrets, credentials, and sensitive information in code.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Only contains instructions and documentation for detecting hardcoded secrets. All capabilities are explicitly documented and serve legitimate security auditing purposes.

content.user_title: Detect secrets and credentials in code
content.value_statement: Hardcoded secrets in code create serious security vulnerabilities. This skill helps you scan repositories for exposed API keys, passwords, and credentials before they become breaches.
actual_capabilities: Scan for hardcoded API keys, tokens, and passwords
Detect cloud provider credentials (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Identify private keys and certificates in code
Analyze database connection strings for exposure
Perform entropy analysis for high-randomness strings
limitations: This is a prompt-based skill - it does not execute external scanning tools
Requires user to run recommended tools (gitleaks, truffleHog, git-secrets) separately
Does not access or modify files without explicit user instruction
Detection accuracy depends on configured patterns and entropy thresholds

use_cases.title: Pre-commit security checks
use_cases.description: Scan code before commits to prevent secrets from entering version control history.

use_cases.title: CI/CD pipeline security
use_cases.description: Integrate secret scanning into deployment pipelines to catch credentials before production.

use_cases.title: Repository security audits
use_cases.description: Audit repositories before public release to ensure no credentials are exposed.

prompt_templates.title: Basic scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Scan this codebase for accidentally committed secrets. Look for AWS keys, API tokens, passwords, and private keys. List findings by severity.

prompt_templates.title: Git history scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Scan git history for secrets. Check all commits for exposed credentials and generate a report of compromised data.

prompt_templates.title: Pattern-based scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for Stripe, SendGrid, and Twilio API keys in the codebase. Report any matches with file locations and line numbers.

prompt_templates.title: Comprehensive audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a comprehensive secret audit including regex patterns, entropy analysis, and false positive filtering. Provide a remediation report with prioritized actions.

output: Recommendation: Rotate all credentials immediately and remove from git history

best_practices: Run secret scanner before every commit and before pushing to remote repositories
Integrate automated scanning in CI/CD pipelines to catch secrets before deployment
Use environment variables and secrets managers instead of hardcoding credentials
anti_patterns: Committing .env files with real credentials to version control
Ignoring secret scanner warnings to meet deadlines
Using TODO comments to mark secrets for later removal (remove them immediately instead)

faq.question: What tools does this skill use for scanning?
faq.answer: The skill provides instructions for using gitleaks, truffleHog, git-secrets, and detect-secrets. You install and run these tools separately.

faq.question: Does this skill access my files without permission?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill that provides guidance. It cannot access files unless you explicitly request a scan.

faq.question: Can this skill remove secrets from my code?
faq.answer: No. The skill generates reports with remediation steps. You must manually remove secrets and clean git history using provided commands.

faq.question: Does this skill send data to external servers?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides instructions. Any data transmission would come from the external scanning tools you choose to run.

faq.question: How accurate is secret detection?
faq.answer: Detection uses pattern matching and entropy analysis. False positives are possible. The skill includes guidance on distinguishing real secrets from examples.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub's secret scanning?
faq.answer: GitHub scans for known patterns after push. This skill provides proactive scanning before commit, including git history analysis and custom patterns.
